content: Cookies must be accepted in TB for OAuth to work: Settings/Privacy & Security, WebContent.
creator: sfhowes

content: The 'Toggle message threads' icon (1st picture) appears if the Thread column is enabled (2nd picture). Hide the icon by disabling the Thread column (right-click any column button).
creator: sfhowes

content:
sfhowes said
I don't see that button, unless you mean the icon for the Threads column. Can you post a picture?

So, if your message list is set to card view, this button disappears, but if it's set to table view, like how it used to be before, There is a button, that says: "Toggle message threads button" when my screen reader focuses onto it. To focus onto it, first, press tab until your focus is in the folder list. then press tab one more time. Instead of focusing on the message list, your focus is on this button. If you still can't see it, i'll send in a picture
creator: hadi.gsf

content: I don't see that button, unless you mean the icon for the Threads column. Can you post a picture?
creator: sfhowes

content:
sfhowes said
Click the Quick Folder button to toggle it off, then click the icon next to that button to Hide Message List Header (see picture).

Hi there This removed two of the three buttons, was very helpful. IS there a way to also remove "toggle message threads button" as well? Thank you!
creator: hadi.gsf

content: Click the Quick Folder button to toggle it off, then click the icon next to that button to Hide Message List Header (see picture).
creator: sfhowes

content: You summarized all the steps in detail, so I am not sure what you are asking.

content:
I do not want to view the message pane and I disabled it. But it always comes back.

Earlier, somebody posted : Try this: Help/Troubleshooting, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, delete session.json, the file that stores the TB layout when it's closed. Restart TB and see if the Message Pane status is retained.

Can you please be more clear?

content: Click settings>composition and scroll down to ADDRESSING section and untick that box.

content: The Yahoo window is for authenticating your account to allow TB access when the authentication method for the account in TB is OAuth2, as it should be. Cookies must be accepted in TB Settings for OAuth2 to complete. After OAuth2 completes, a token will be stored in Saved Passwords.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Any reason you need the language pack for the daily version? Language packs for the release and beta versions are available, e.g. for the release:

https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/115.1.1/linux-x86_64/xpi/

for the beta:

https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/117.0b6/linux-x86_64/xpi/
creator: sfhowes
